properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: communities north of Mount Buangor National Park.
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for smoke at communities north of Mount Buangor National Park..

  • You will see or smell smoke across the north of Beaufort extending to St Arnaud in the evening and into Monday morning.
  • This smoke is a result of the large bushfire at Mount Buangor National Park. 
  • The intensity of smoke from the fire has reduced since the peak on Thursday, likely indicating that temperatures of the fire has reduced, however the lower temperature may mean that smoke may not be travelling high and could have a greater ground level impact and be smoky or hazy in your area.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

The VicEmergency Hotline provides information during and after major bushfire incidents.  In a situation where you can see or smell smoke call the VicEmergency Hotline 1800 226 226.
What you should do:

  • Your nose is an excellent smoke detector. If you can smell smoke, take the necessary precautions to protect your health. You can self-assess the air quality near you using https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health.
  • Check EPA Airwatch for changes to air quality throughout the day and follow the advice provided.
Take action to reduce your exposure to smoke and protect your health: 
  • Everyone should minimise the time spent in smoky conditions whenever practical to do so.
  • People over 65 years, children 14 years and younger, pregnant women and those with existing heart or lung conditions, should reduce prolonged or heavy physical activity. Where possible (and not under direct threat from fires), also limit the time spent outdoors and when indoors, close windows and doors. If there is a break in smoky conditions, open the windows and air out your home.
  • Anyone with a heart or lung condition should take their medication as prescribed. People with asthma should follow their personal asthma action plan, continue to take preventer medication as prescribed and keep reliever medication on hand.
  • If you or anyone in your care is worried about symptoms, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 60 60 24.
  • Anyone experiencing difficulty breathing or tightness in the chest should seek urgent medical assistance and call Triple Zero (000).
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last smoke message issued.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.  
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - AIR QUALITY - Stay Informed
Incident Location: North of Beaufort
Issue Date: Sunday 25 February 2024, 07:22 pm
Next Update: Monday 26 February 2024, 10:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33107/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for smoke at communities north of Mount Buangor National Park..

- You will see or smell smoke across the north of Beaufort extending to St Arnaud in the evening and into Monday morning.
- This smoke is a result of the large bushfire at Mount      Buangor National Park. 
- The intensity of smoke from the fire has reduced since      the peak on Thursday, likely indicating that temperatures of the fire has      reduced, however the lower temperature may mean that smoke may not be      travelling high and could have a greater ground level impact and be smoky      or hazy in your area.  


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required. 

The VicEmergency Hotline provides information during and after major bushfire incidents.  In a situation where you can see or smell smoke call the VicEmergency Hotline 1800 226 226.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Main Lead, Waterloo. 
  •  It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning area. 
  • The bushfire at  Bayindeen Rocky Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is still active in this area.
It is Not Safe to Return - If you have not left, Leaving Now is your best option.
What you should do:
If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance. 

If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. 
  • A relief centre is open at:
    - Ararat Football Ground, Alexandra Oval, Waratah Street, Ararat.
    - Princes Park, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
  • Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:
  • The following roads are closed:
  • Pyrenees Highway at Crowlands- Eversley Road 
  • Beaufort-Lexton RoadLexton to Ararat Road
  • Main Lead Road
  • Beaufort at Jackson Street
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road
  • Amphitheatre road
  • Mount Cole Road
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road
  • Ferntree Gully Road
  • Jones Road
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 

  
  • Residents will be required to show proof of address at the traffic management point located on Eurabben Raglan Road near the Western Highway should they wish to leave the area to obtain required staples.
  • Residents are required to enter and exit via this same Traffic Management Point.This access may change in the next few days.
Relief centres are open at: 
- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough. For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).

  • Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
  • As of 0700hrs today Sunday the 25 February 2024, the Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 

    The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   

    Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

    The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire.
    DEECA closures:

  • Mount Cole State Forest- 
  • Ben Major State Forest- 
  • Mt Lonach State Forest- 
  • Fortes Bush State Forest- 
  • Musical Gully State Forest- 
  • Camphill State Forest 
Parks Vic Closures
 
  • Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)- 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  Community Meeting  
Community Meeting

A community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68lLrwz/    

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 
The next update is expected by 26/02/2024 08:10 am or as the situation changes. 
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Incident Location: Bayindeen Rocky Road
Issue Date: Monday 26 February 2024, 12:24 am
Next Update: Monday 26 February 2024, 08:10 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33117/moreinfo

What you should do:
If you have not already left: 
- Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
- Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance. 

If you have already left:

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Green Hill Creek, Lexton, Rosyth, Lamplough
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Green Hill Creek, Lamplough, Lexton, Rosyth. 
  • It is Safe to Return for people who left the area due to the bushfire at Bayindeen Rocky Road.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice Message issued at 10.36am Sunday 25 February, 2024.
The threat is reduced and it is now safe for you to return to your home or business. You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
What you should do: 
  • Stay alert - be aware of hazards caused by the fire. 
  • Be aware of road hazards such as fallen trees and any road closures. 
  • Check your home or building for damage before you re-enter. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.


Impacts in your area:
  • Residents will be required to show proof of address within the warning area at traffic management points.  Residents are required to enter and exit via the same Traffic Management Point.

  • A fire in a shed containing tyres has been identified near Raglan-Elmhurst Road, Raglan. Reduce your exposure to smoke.  Tyre fires generate hazardous smoke, which can cause a health risk. This is through the inhalation of particles and chemicals. 
    For more information on smoke and your health visit: https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health.

    Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

    The following roads are closed: 
    - Pyrenees Highway at Crowlands- Eversley Road Beaufort-Lexton Road (C172).
    - Lexton to Beaufort Road.
    - Main Lead Road, Beaufort at Jackson Street. 
    - Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen.
     Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.  

    Relief centres are open at:
    - Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
    - Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

    For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).

    Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
    The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM. Outside these hours community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.  

    Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure. 
    Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

    The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire
    DEECA closures:
    - Mount Cole State Forest
    - Ben Major State Forest
    - Mt Lonach State Forest
    - Fortes Bush State Forest
    - Musical Gully State Forest
    - Camphill State Forest  

    Parks Victoria closures:
    - Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)
    - Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  

    Community Meeting  
    A community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68lLrwz/    
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  


Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for water quality at Lake Bolac. 
  • High levels of blue-green algae have been detected in the lake. 
  • The algal bloom is expected to remain until there is significant rainfall to flush the lake or cooler conditions slow the algae. 
  • Regular testing is being conducted to identify new outbreaks or changes that might indicate improved water quality. 
  • This notification will be reviewed weekly and updated as the situation changes.
Warning signs have been installed at the lake.

You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe. 
What you should do:
  • Visit Parks Victoria website (https://www.parks.vic.gov.au/places-to-see/parks/lake-bolac-highway-park) for more information. 
  • Observe information signs posted at the lake.
Protect your health:
  • Direct contact with water affected by blue green algae can cause skin irritation, sore eyes, ears and nose. If swallowed it can cause cramps, nausea and vomiting. 
  • If you do come into contact with affected water, wash your skin immediately in clean cool water. 
  • Boiling affected water does not make it safe to drink. Boiling water bursts the blue green algae cells and releases toxins into the water making it more likely that you will experience symptoms. 
  • If you are experiencing any health issues after contact with affected water seek medical advice from your local doctor or Nurse-On-Call on 1300 60 60 24.
Protect your pets:
  • Pet owners should prevent pets from drinking or having direct contact with contaminated water. 
Agriculture information: 
  • Irrigation water contaminated with blue-green algae should not be spray irrigated on vegetables and fruit, or come in contact with plants being grown for food during processing and packing. 
  • Fruit and vegetables grown in the affected areas are safe to consume if farmers follow recommendations regarding blue-green algae
Impacts in your area:
  • The water is  green as a result of the algae bloom.
Boating and fishing:
  • Boating and fishing is still allowed in these areas, however care needs to be taken.
  • Fish caught from affected areas should be rinsed and cleaned thoroughly in fresh water, and internal organs removed from the fish and discarded before eating. 
  • Do not eat mussels, crayfish or yabbies caught from the affected area. 
This message was issued by Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action.

The next update is expected by 31/03/2024 05:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Information about blue green algae:
  • For information on blue green algae visit: www2.health.vic.gov.au/public-health/water/blue-green-algae-cyanobac teria.
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter.
  • Tune into ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BLUE GREEN ALGAE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Lake Bolac
Issue Date: Tuesday 23 January 2024, 03:14 pm
Next Update: Sunday 31 March 2024, 05:20 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/32563/moreinfo

This message is being issued for water quality at Lake Bolac. 
- High levels of blue-green algae have been detected in the lake. 
- The algal bloom is expected to remain until there is significant rainfall to flush the lake or cooler conditions slow the algae. 
- Regular testing is being conducted to identify new outbreaks or changes that might indicate improved water quality. 
- This notification will be reviewed weekly and updated as the situation changes. 



Warning signs have been installed at the lake. 
You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Dadswells Bridge. 

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Mt Stapylton that is under control.
  • Fire crews continue to patrol the fire area.
  • Strong winds may cause internal hot spots to flare up and generate increased smoke.
  • There are reduced speed limits in place on the Western Highway through Dadswell Bridge.

Areas of the Grampians National Park near the Bellfield fire remain closed.

For detailed information on which areas of park are open or closed, visit Parks.vic.gov.au

Parks are closed or partially closed to ensure your safety.  Remember, disobeying closure orders is an offence under the National Parks Act, with fines for non compliance.
There is no immediate threat to the community or travellers on the Western Highway.  You should stay informed and plan what you will do if the situation changes.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 26/02/2024 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Grampians National Park, Mt Stapylton Issue Date: Sunday 25 February 2024, 11:52 am Next Update: Monday 26 February 2024, 10:00 am More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33088/moreinfo This Community Information message is being issued for Dadswells Bridge. - There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Mt Stapylton that is under control. - Fire crews continue to patrol the fire area. - Strong winds may cause internal hot spots to flare up and generate increased smoke. - There are reduced speed limits in place on the Western Highway through Dadswell Bridge. Areas of the Grampians National Park near the Bellfield fire remain closed. For detailed information on which areas of park are open or closed, visit Parks.vic.gov.au Parks are closed or partially closed to ensure your safety. Remember, disobeying closure orders is an offence under the National Parks Act, with fines for non compliance. There is no immediate threat to the community or travellers on the Western Highway. You should stay informed and plan what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.location: Glenlofty, Glenpatrick, Glenshee, Nowhere Creek, Avoca
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Avoca, Glenlofty, Glenpatrick, Glenshee, Nowhere Creek. 
  • It is Safe to Return for people who left the area due to the bushfire at Bayindeen Rocky Road. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice Message issued at 10.36am Wednesday 25 February, 2024 and the Watch and Act for communities north of the Pyrenees Highway.
The threat is reduced and it is now safe for you to return to your home or business.
You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
What you should do: 
  • Stay alert - be aware of hazards caused by the fire. 
  • Be aware of road hazards such as fallen trees and any road closures. 
  • Check your home or building for damage before you re-enter. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area:
  • Residents will be required to show proof of address within the Warning area at Traffic Management Points.  Residents are required to enter and exit via the same Traffic Management Point.

  • A fire in a shed containing tyres has been identified near Raglan-Elmhurst Road, Raglan. Reduce your exposure to smoke.  Tyre fires generate hazardous smoke, which can cause a health risk. This is through the inhalation of particles and chemicals. 
    For more information on smoke and your health visit: https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health .

     Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

    The following roads are closed: 
    - Pyrenees Highway at Crowlands- Eversley Road Beaufort-Lexton Road (C172).
    - Lexton to Beaufort Road.
    - Main Lead Road, Beaufort at Jackson Street.
    - Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen.

    Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.  

    Relief centres are open at: 
    - Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
    - Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
    For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).
  •  
    Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
    The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM. Outside these hours community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns.  The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   

    Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

    The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire.
    DEECA closures:
     - Mount Cole State Forest
     - Ben Major State Forest
     - Mt Lonach State Forest
     - Fortes Bush State Forest
     - Musical Gully State Forest
     - Camphill State Forest  

    Parks Victoria closures:
    - Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)
    - Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  

    Community Meeting
     A community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate.  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68lLrwz/ 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  


Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Lakes Entrance beach.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity.
  • The whale carcass is located at the east of Drew's Jetty. 
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
Avoid the area. Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:

  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.
Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
Impacts in your area:
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is monitoring for shark sightings and providing advice to relevant authorities. 
This message was issued by VFA.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 03:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Chute, Langi Kal Kal, Lexton, Waterloo
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky Road. 

  • This Advice message replaces the emergency warning issued at 7:33pm on Saturday 25 February 2024..
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
Impacts in your area:
  • Impacts in your area:Residents will be required to show proof of address within the warning area at traffic management points.  

  • The following roads are closed: - 

  • Pyrenees Highway at Crowlands- Eversley Road 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road (C172).- 
  • Lexton to Beaufort Road.- 
  • Main Lead Road, Beaufort at Jackson Street. -
  •  Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.  
  • Relief centres are open at:- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
  • For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).Beaufort Urgent Care CentreThe Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM. Outside these hours community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
  • The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.  
  • Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure. Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

  • The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire

DEECA closures:- Mount Cole State Forest- 
Ben Major State Forest- 
Mt Lonach State Forest- 
Fortes Bush State Forest- 
Musical Gully State Forest- Camphill State Forest  
Parks Victoria closures:- Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)- Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Bayindeen-Rocky Road
Issue Date: Sunday 25 February 2024, 09:57 pm
Next Update: Monday 26 February 2024, 06:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33114/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky Road. 

- This Advice message replaces the emergency warning issued at 7:33pm on Saturday 25 February 2024.. 


People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities. 
You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Raglan, Eurambeen, Buangor East, Buangor, Middle Creek
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Buangor, Middle Creek, Raglan, Eurambeen, Buangor East. 
  • It is Safe to Return for people who left the area due to the bushfire at Bayindeen Rocky Road. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 2.30pm Sunday 25 February, 2024.
The threat is reduced and it is now safe for you to return to your home or business.
You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
What you should do: 
  • Stay alert - be aware of hazards caused by the fire. 
  • Be aware of road hazards such as fallen trees and any road closures. 
  • Check your home or building for damage before you re-enter. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area:
  • Residents will be required to show proof of address within the Warning area at Traffic Management Points.  Residents are required to enter and exit via the same Traffic Management Point.

    The following roads are closed:
    - Pyrenees Highway at Crowlands- Eversley Road Beaufort-Lexton Road (C172).
    - Lexton to Beaufort Road.
    - Main Lead Road, Beaufort at Jackson Street.
    - Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen.

    Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 

    A fire in a shed containing tyres has been identified near Raglan-Elmhurst Road, Raglan. Reduce your exposure to smoke.  Tyre fires generate hazardous smoke, which can cause a health risk. This is through the inhalation of particles and chemicals. For more information on smoke and your health visit: https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health .

  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

    Relief centres are open at:
    - Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
    - Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
     For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).

    Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
    The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM. Outside these hours community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
    The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.

    Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

    The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire.
    DEECA closures:
    - Mount Cole State Forest
     - Ben Major State Forest
     - Mt Lonarch State Forest
     - Fortes Bush State Forest
     - Musical Gully State Forest
     - Camphill State Forest  

    Parks Victoria closures:
     - Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)
     - Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  

    Community Meeting
    A community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate 
    A recording of the Meeting  is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68lLrwz/   
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  


Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Pomonal. 

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Bellfield that is under control.
  • Fire crews remain in the area monitoring conditions and treating fire damaged trees.  For your safety, stay away.
  • Strong winds may cause internal hot spots to flare up and generate increased smoke.
  • Fire affected trees can be dangerous.  You should stay clear of them.
  • Some parts of the Grampians  National Park are closed.  Check parks.vic.gov.au for more information.
  • Access to Pomonal is restricted to local residents, emergency services and essential services.   Check the VicTraffic website (VicTraffic) or call 13 11 70 for road claosures.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 26/02/2024 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Grampians National Park, Bellfield Issue Date: Sunday 25 February 2024, 12:25 pm Next Update: Monday 26 February 2024, 10:00 am More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33089/moreinfo This Community Information message is being issued for Pomonal. - There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Bellfield that is under control. - Fire crews remain in the area monitoring conditions and treating fire damaged trees. For your safety, stay away. - Strong winds may cause internal hot spots to flare up and generate increased smoke. - Fire affected trees can be dangerous. You should stay clear of them. - Some parts of the Grampians National Park are closed. Check parks.vic.gov.au for more information. - Access to Pomonal is restricted to local residents, emergency services and essential services. Check the VicTraffic website (VicTraffic) or call 13 11 70 for road claosures. There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Langi Kal Kal, Trawalla, Beaufort, Waterloo
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Beaufort, Langi Kal Kal, Trawalla, Waterloo. 
  • It is Safe to Return for people who left the area due to the bushfire at Bayindeen Rocky Road. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 10.36am Sunday 24 February, 2024.
The threat is reduced and it is now safe for you to return to your home or business. You should stay informed as the fire situation can change quickly.
What you should do: 
  • Stay alert - be aware of hazards caused by the fire. 
  • Be aware of road hazards such as fallen trees and any road closures. 
  • Check your home or building for damage before you re-enter. 
  • If you have any questions about recovering from this fire, you should call the VicEmergency Hotline on free call 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area:
Residents will be required to show proof of address within the warning area at traffic management points.  Residents are required to enter and exit via the same Traffic Management Point.

A fire in a shed containing tyres has been identified near Raglan-Elmhurst Road, Raglan. Reduce your exposure to smoke.  Tyre fires generate hazardous smoke, which can cause a health risk. This is through the inhalation of particles and chemicals. For more information on smoke and your health visit: https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health .

Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

The following roads are closed: 
- Pyrenees Highway at Crowlands- Eversley Road.
- Beaufort-Lexton Road (C172). 
- Lexton to Beaufort Road.
- Main Lead Road, Beaufort at Jackson Street.
- Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen.

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.  

Relief centres are open at:
- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).  

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre
As of 0700hrs today Sunday the 25 February 2024, the Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   

Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Mt Cole Fire.
DEECA closures:
- Mount Cole State Forest
- Ben Major State Forest
- Mt Lonach State Forest
- Fortes Bush State Forest
- Musical Gully State Forest
- Camphill State Forest  

Parks Victoria closures:
- Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)
- Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  

Community Meeting  
A community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68lLrwz/ 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  


Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Glenpatrick, Raglan
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Glenpatrick, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Raglan.  

  •  It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning Area.
  • There is a bushfire that is still active.
It is Not Safe to Return.  If you have not left the area, Leaving Now is your best option.
What you should do:
If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance. 

If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. 
  • A relief centre is open at:
    -  Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
    -  Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

    For medical emergencies, call Triple Zero (000).
  • Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

Impacts in your area:

  • Residents will be required to show proof of address at the traffic management point located on Eurabben Raglan Road near the Western Highway should they wish to leave the area to obtain required staples.
  • Residents are required to enter and exit via this same Traffic Management Point.
  • This access may change in the next few days.
 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

The following roads are closed:  - 
  • Pyrenees Highway at Crowlands- Eversley Road 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road
  • Lexton to Ararat Road
  • Main Lead Road
  • Beaufort at Jackson Street
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road
  • Amphitheatre road
  • Mount Cole Road
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road
  • Ferntree Gully Road
  • Jones Road

  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.  
Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

  • As of 0700hrs today Sunday the 25 February 2024, the Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort has re-opened with reduced hours of operations between 0700 AM and 1000 PM.  Outside these hours, community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns. 
  • The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   
  • Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.   

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- RockyRoad Fire.

DEECA closures:- 

Mount Cole State Forest- 
Ben Major State Forest-
 Mt Lonach State Forest- 
Fortes Bush State Forest- 
Musical Gully State Forest- 
Camphill State Forest  

Parks Victoria closures:- 

  • Mount Buangor State Park  (those whom have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)- 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR)  Community Meeting  A community meeting was held at the Beaufort Reserve on Sunday 25 February, 2024.  This meeting was livestreamed and can be viewed on the Pyrenees Shire Council Facebook page or the Pyrenees Shire Council have included some community information at https://www.pyrenees.vic.gov.au/fireupdate  A recording of the Meeting is available at https://fb.watch/qqs68lLrwz/    
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 
The next update is expected by 26/02/2024 08:00 am or as the situation changes. 
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
